snippet: The Federal Reserve said it transferred $76.9 billion in profits to the Treasury Department last year, slightly less than its 2010 transfer but much more than in any other previous year.
abstract: Federal Reserve says it contributed $76.9 billion in profits to the Treasury Department in 2011, slightly less than its record transfer in 2010, but far more than in any other previous year; Fed is required by law to turn over its profits to the Treasury annually, a profitable byproduct of the central bank's campaign to stimulate economic growth.
lead_paragraph: The Federal Reserve said it transferred $76.9 billion in profits to the Treasury Department last year, slightly less than its 2010 transfer but much more than in any other previous year.

headline.seo: Fed Returns $77 Billion in Profits to Treasury
headline.main: Fed Turns Over $77 Billion in Profits to the Treasury
headline.print_headline: Fed Turns Over $77 Billion In Profits to the Treasury
